meta.name: description
meta.content: In Stockton Unified, we share an unshakeable belief that ALL students can and will graduate college, career, and community ready. In doing so, we will lift youth out of poverty.

div.p: This meeting will be held at 6:00 PM. Click here for more information.

a.title: Go to comments for Board Meeting, April 28
Alternative Formats
Go to comments for Student Support Services Helpline

img.alt: Local and National Emergency Hotline Information

a.span: Local and National Emergency Hotline Information

a.title: Alternative Formats

div.p: Click here for a compiled list of national hotlines and local hotlines that are critical during these uncertain times.

a.title: Go to comments for Local and National Emergency Hotline Information

div.p: SUSD is committed to celebrating the accomplishments of our IB students, eighth-graders, and our graduating class of 2020!

a.title: Go to comments for Plans for Promotions & Commencement Ceremonies

img.alt: Breakfast and Lunch Pick-up Schedule Update

a.span: Breakfast and Lunch Pick-up Schedule Update

div.p: SUSD will be providing breakfast and lunch meal pick-up for any child 18 and under while classes are canceled.

a.title: Go to comments for Breakfast and Lunch Pick-up Schedule Update

img.alt: Distance Learning Continuing Through the Remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year

a.span: Distance Learning Continuing Through the Remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year

div.p: We are prepared to provide TK-12 student learning materials that are self-guided and should be seen as a way to review and reinforce instruction students have already received from their teachers.

a.title: Go to comments for Distance Learning Continuing Through the Remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year

a.span: Telephone Town Hall Meetings to Address COVID-19

div.p: SUSD Superintendent John Deasy will be hosting several Tele-Town Hall Meetings to address COVID-19 (coronavirus).

a.title: Go to comments for Telephone Town Hall Meetings to Address COVID-19

img.alt: Career Technical Education (CTE) Stakeholder Engagement Forums

a.span: Career Technical Education (CTE) Stakeholder Engagement Forums

div.p: The District is hosting a series of Career Technical Education (CTE) Stakeholder Engagement Forums to hear from stakeholders on the current state of CTE within the district and to seek your input in assembling our Comprehensive Local Needs Assessment (CLNA), formerly known as our CTE district plan.

a.title: Go to comments for Career Technical Education (CTE) Stakeholder Engagement Forums

a.span: Technology and Internet Access for Families

div.p: Stockton Unified has transitioned to Distance Learning. If you are in need of a Chromebook or Internet resources, please click here.

a.title: Go to comments for Technology and Internet Access for Families

img.alt: Stockton Unified is Currently Seeking Volunteers

a.span: Stockton Unified is Currently Seeking Volunteers

div.p: We have seen many posts online from people eager to support our community during this unprecedented time. We are grateful for your willingness to support and excited to finally share how you can get involved!

a.title: Go to comments for Stockton Unified is Currently Seeking Volunteers

a.span: SUSD Class Cancellation Extended Through the Remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year

div.p: In response to COVID-19 (Coronavirus), Stockton Unified School District will cancel all PK-12 and adult classes and school-related activities through the remainder of the 2019-2020 school year

a.title: Go to comments for SUSD Class Cancellation Extended Through the Remainder of the 2019-2020 School Year

img.alt: SUSD Offices, Buildings, and Facilities are closed

a.span: All SUSD Offices, Buildings, & Facilities are Closed to the Public

div.p: To minimize the spread of the COVID-19 (Coronavirus), all Stockton Unified School District Offices, Buildings, and Facilities will close to the public beginning Tuesday, March 17th, 2020. These closures will be in effect until further notice.

a.title: Go to comments for All SUSD Offices, Buildings, & Facilities are Closed to the Public

div.script: $(document).ready(function() {CheckScript('ModuleView');CheckScript('Mustache'); });

div.p: We will establish a high-performing and caring culture in our schools, the school district and in our community by: Establishing high and unambiguous expectations for adults and youth; Implementing the support necessary for trauma-informed care and instruction; Providing rigorous and engaging instruction at all levels; Deeply investing in the development of all employees; and Ensuring high-quality choices for all youth in their education as well as their educational setting.

a.title: Go to comments for Culture & Community in our Schools

div.p: Our declared goals for the dramatic improvement of our culture and community will be possible with a set of supporting elements that are for all youth and adults in SUSD.

a.title: Go to comments for Supporting Elements

div.p: Our Theory of Action is how we believe the district’s work will best be done. Our Theory of Instruction is how we believe the art of teaching and learning develops our students. Our Theory of Change is the system we believe will best guide the improvements we seek and support our theories of instruction and action.

a.title: Go to comments for Theories of Action, Instruction, & Change

div.aria-label: Scroll to the top of the page.

div.p: Stockton Unified School District is committed to providing a working and learning environment free from discrimination, harassment, intimidation and bullying. For more information regarding nondiscrimination, please click here.

Stockton Unified School District is committed to providing a working and learning environment free from discrimination, harassment, intimidation and bullying. For more information regarding nondiscrimination, please click here.
